content.description: Tricky climbing. May seem harder than Hope Springs Eternal for some.
content.location: Just right of Hope Springs Eternal

content.description: A stout and thoughtful climb with two distinct cruxes.  Some fun laybacking and footwork oriented climbing (isn't it all?) lead to the upper face.  The final crux may be height dependent (12a?), pull down on crimps and pockets, possibly deadpointing for the shorties.  Shares anchors with Get On With It (12b) to the left.
content.location: Located in the middle of the Wilds, with an obvious left leaning seam.  From the left side of the wall with the slab to bulge route (Candyman), then three 5.10 routes, then the fiercely thin Get on With It (12b), followed by The Wilds (11d+).  Savages (13a) is just to the right.

content.description:
The arete climbing on this one is really unique for sinks and is alot of fun. Unfortunately is shares the terrible start as Blammo, but the rest of the climb is great.

Climb up geasy slopey holds at the bottom to gain the crack at the roof. Traverse left on underclings and begin balancing your way up the arete with few face holds.

Better than Blammo IMO.
content.protection: 8 Bolts, It helps to extend the 4th bolt before traversing to the arete
content.location: The bolted arete to the left of the diagonal combustification cracks

content.description: corner with bushes to the right of "savages". a dirty grovel.
A nice easy slab that climbs up good nubbins and uses some holds on the arete. There are loose rocks in the crack to the left so be aware.
content.location: The slab/arete to the left of the blammo crack. It is right of a new unknown 5.10

content.description: Really fun climb with a low technical crux and a high, pumpy one. Slightly gritty near the top, but should clean up. A little bit of everything from technical slabby face to steep pockets.
content.location: Just right of Smell My Finger.

content.description: This one felt like a slightly more distinct crux after the 2nd bolt than sandman to it's right, with  delicate and balancy climbing.
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts to anchors below the roof.
content.location: TF is on the left side of the wilds, but the 2nd line to the right of the left facing corner, so 3 lines to the right of Candy Man.

climbs.name: Tails to the Wind
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner Jr, Dennis Van Denbos, Mike Lilygren

content.description: The crux for most is hanging on to the end. Make sure you get the sequence right for clipping the anchor.
content.location: Just right of  Waiting on a Friend. Note the large flake (solid) 25-40 feet up.

content.description:
Begin the same as Candy Man, on the low-angle "Candy Man Intro" ramp.  At the first anchors, continue up and right on sinker jugs with a high crux. This one of the tallest routes at the wilds.

For a more sustained experience try the Ankle Device link up,  a small but easy run-out will apply.
content.location: This route is at the far west end of the Wilds Wall.  It begins in a weakness and climbs up a very featured ramp before pulling onto a headwall above.

content.description: Beneath huge roof and behind giant burned down juniper tree, a dirty little slab, technical and devious.
to the right of "wicked garden".  bouldery beginning to 5.12 exit to overhang, decent

Better than it looks, and quite fun at that.  Climbs some delicate 5.10ish lower angle rock through a few bolts before continuous 5.11- climbing punches through the upper headwall.  Fun climbing on mostly good holds.
content.location: Located in a cluster or four or so climbs around the corner maybe 40 yards left of Purple Galaxy.  You must pass an obvious bolted step left facing corner about half way between Purple Galaxy and the cluster or routes. SMF is the left-most line of the routes (12b,11c,11d,Smell My Finger 11c).

content.description: Two routes to the right of "the wilds". A technical black water streak that has several hard cruxes. Expect a burly thin crux on a microscopic crimp at half height, and the iconic mono crux near the top. One of the first 5.13 sport routes in Wyoming. Classic.
A little dirty still. A burly thumbdercling start leads to more crimpiness and a mellower finish.
content.location: Located on the little cliff about 100 yards climber's left of the main Wilds wall.

content.description: This lines begins with a few thin moves up to a right facing layaway flake.  Pumpy barn door climbing up the flake lead to fun continuous climbing to the anchors, just into the final bulge.
content.location: Located towards the left side of the Wilds, the third line to the right of the left facing corner.  Sandman is just right of Tooth Fairy and easily picked out via the right facing arcing flake.

content.description: Bouldery start gains the fractured flake system to face above.
content.location: Just right of The Physical.

content.description: Long route with a pumpy finish. A bit sandy.
bouldery at start to sustained groove up high, just to right of "snap back.." and identified by a line of huecos by 2nd or 3rd bolt
Slab right of corner,;will be the first route you walk by on your way to the rest of the routes in the Wilds.  Just to the right of Bust a Nut.
Varied climbing with crux at the bulge.
content.location: 8 feet left of Bust a Nut

content.description: Sustained technical moves. Stays close to the rounded arete. Shares anchor with Dark Days.
content.location: Just right of Dark days.

content.description:
"The King and I" is a nice short route on great rock with some fun pocket moves.

It starts with a boulder problem off of underclings in a mini roof to small pockets above the first bolt (crux). After the second bolt, continue up bigger incut pockets on the gently overhanging bulge.

A stick clip is nice to have as the crux is right off the ground.
content.location: This is on the small buttress a little ways past The Wilds towards Fairfield. The King and I is just left of "The Royal We". Look for the grey hangers up the black streak.

content.description: Fiercely thin crimping, well describe this line.  Meander through the first few bolts to a thin crux.  Some fairly continuous, but not so thin climbing follows to the chains.  Rumor has it this is the hardest 12b at Sinks.  Shares anchors with the Wilds.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors shared with the Wilds.
content.location: To the left of the Wilds (11d), and to the right of a trio of 10's including Sandman.

content.description: Left of Earth AD. Prow of sorts and friable face holds.
Just left of "candy man". Pockets and huecos, well protected.
Stem corner through bulge down low then step out onto the face. Pockets and side pulls lead to and through crux bulge above.
content.location: 7’ right of Blue Collar

content.description: Start in corner just to the right of Bust a Nut. Move up corner and then work onto face out right. Finish with great position on arete.
content.location: Just right of Bust a Nut in big left facing corner.

content.description: Huge roof feature at the Wilds area with  routes beneath it, from left to right this is the first route, identified by twin cracks running up and to the right.
Immediately left of Achin' for Bootie.  Similar climbing, slightly easier.
content.location: Overhanging wall of 5.11 all stacked neatly next to each other at the corner of the cliff.

content.description: The beginning / 1st pitch of this climb climbs great holds up to the intermediate anchor.
content.location: Located on the left side of the wall, to the left of the left facing corner, below the steeper "2nd pitch" above.

content.description: An easy romp to the intermediate chains, leads to steep pocket pulling of the fun variety.  Worth 2.5 stars, would be more if it were longer lived.
content.location: Located on the left side of the wall, just past the left facing corner.

content.description: under roof, the most right route, identified by a lieback/finger crack half way up route, great moves and interesting
beneath roof, climb up a prow to gain higher face, devious as well and hard for the grade
Scramble up slab then surmount bulge. Consistent climbing throughout leads to steep finish.
content.location: Ten feet right of Riff Raff.

content.description: Start on crimps, which lead to a small roof.  Move right around the roof and continue upward until the crack ends and pockets start.
content.location: Start up into a right-facing dihedral/crack just left of Combustification (the obvious double crack system).  Stay right when the bolts branch.

content.description: Follow the corner up and until you can step left onto the face. Continue up to anchor. Named after the rare mega-beaver moon.
content.location: Starts in the corner just left of New Age Gal and just right of Winter Solstice

content.description: 20' of easy slab climbing leads to steep bulge. Surmount the bulge on thin crimps (crux) then make your way to the small roof. Pull roof on long moves. Upper headwall and final bulge are on decent pockets though steep and pumpy.
content.location: 10' left of Ride the Apocalypse. Also 10' right of BrrAvery (not listed on mountain project).

content.description: climb left along the flake or up harder line on right? after standing atop flake and reaching large dish, head right toward harder but fun finish
just to the right of "savages", obvious hueco above first bolt, start w/ first bolt pre clipped and boulder out the bottom crux to (2) 5.12 cruxes above.
content.location: between "savages" and "wicked garden"

content.description:
Awesome cave climbing for the 5.11 climber !! The crux is near the top, but there's no place to rest.

The swing away from the wall after unclipping your first draw on the way down (way high over easy climbing) is almost as fun as the climbing !
